kawigi.widget
Class ColorSwatchDropdown

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.AbstractButton
                  javax.swing.JToggleButton
                      kawigi.widget.ColorSwatchDropdown
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.PopupMenuListener, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class ColorSwatchDropdown
extends javax.swing.JToggleButton
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, javax.swing.event.PopupMenuListener

Implementation of a button that drops a menu that has a color swatch on it. [rant length="short"] There should be a much simpler way to do this. Unfortunately, JMenus can't be added to anything but JMenuBars and expect to actually work. Therefore, I have to position my own Dropdown from a JToggleButton, which won't work as consistently as a regular Java-implemented menu would (because the menu might go off the edge of the screen). [/rant]

See Also:
Serialized Form
